business.headline: Canara Robeco AMC lists at 5% premium: Why long-term investors should stay investedCanara Robeco AMC made a weak market debut, but is it the right long-term pick? Read to know why experts believe strong fundamentals and steady growth make it a hold-worthy investment.

Is 'playing it safe' with your money quietly making you poorer? Experts explainsMany Indians mistake inactivity for safety. But every idle rupee in your bank account loses value each day. Here's why your comfort zone might be quietly costing you wealth.

Is TCS planning more job cuts? Here's what the IT firm saidAmid speculation over workforce cuts, TCS has given an update on its plans. Speaking at the Q2 earnings call, the HR head shared how the company is approaching staffing and performance reviews.

Rubicon Research makes strong debut, delivers 28% listing gains to investorsThe Rs 1,377.50 crore initial public offering of Rubicon Research received a robust response from investors. The issue was open for subscription between October 9 and October 13 and was subscribed 48 times in total.

Canara Robeco shares debut at 5% premium: Should you buy?The stock opened at Rs 280.25 per share on both the NSE and BSE, compared to its issue price of Rs 266. This marks a premium of 5.36% on the NSE and 5.66% on the BSE.

But experts warn of a short-term correction after Diwali, citing overvaluation and investor profit-taking. However, long-term projections on silver remain bullish. Here's what to know before buying silver on Dhanteras 2025.

Canara Robeco IPO listing today: Will it give investors profit? Check GMPCanara Robeco IPO received an overall subscription of 9.74 times by the close of bidding on October 13, 2025. The IPO allotment was finalised on October 14, 2025.

Contract manufacturers such as Foxconn and Tata have already invested billions of dollars to open iPhone plants in the country.

US tariffs not a matter of huge concern: RBI chief downplays impact on IndiaRBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra dismissed jitters over US tariffs imposed under Donald Trump, saying India's domestic-driven economy can withstand trade pressure.

EPFO new rules: Check myths and facts about PF withdrawalsAfter the announcement, social media was flooded with rumours that employees will no longer be able to withdraw their PF after leaving a job. This is not true.

Opposition slams Centre's EPFO rules, says salaried employees being punishedThe opposition slammed the Modi government over new EPFO rules, accusing it of punishing salaried employees for "economic mismanagement."
Sensex ends 575 points higher, Nifty above 25,300; Bajaj Finance up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 575.45 points to end at 82,605.43, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 178.05 points to close at 25,323.55.

Sugar sector urges government to push ethanol blending beyond 20%: ReportEthanol producers have collectively offered 17,760 million litres for the ethanol supply year 2025–26 (ESY), which far exceeds the oil marketing companies' (OMCs) annual requirement of around 10,500 million litres.

Expecting your entire CTC as salary? Here's the reality checkMany first-time earners walk into their jobs assuming the number on their offer letter will land in their bank account. But when the first payslip arrives, reality hits hard. The gap between CTC and take-home pay is bigger than most realise.

Gold nears Rs 1.3 lakh. Is it wise to buy before Dhanteras?As gold inches close to Rs 1.3 lakh per 10 grams, festive shoppers are facing a dilemma. With Dhanteras around the corner, the big question is simple: buy now or hold off in hope of a dip?

Sensex jumps 500 points: What's driving today's stock market rallyBy mid-morning, the S&P BSE Sensex had gained 474.63 points to 82,504.61, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 161.90 points to 25,309.65. Most other indices across sectors also saw healthy gains, reflecting broad-based buying.

Is Goldman Sachs planning to cut jobs? Check hereGoldman Sachs is gearing up for another round of layoffs as it speeds up its shift towards artificial intelligence under its OneGS 3.0 strategy, mention reports.

Diwali Picks 2025: How can you build your portfolio this festive season As markets steady ahead of Diwali, analysts say the current calm could be the base for the next rally — a chance to quietly build wealth before the noise returns.

Q2 earnings lift IT stocks, but should investors join the rally?Experts suggest that while the IT sector looks promising in the short term, investors should take a cautious approach and focus on selective stocks that show consistent growth potential.

entertainment.headline: Smriti Irani breaks silence on Kyunki 2 body-double controversy and trolls Smriti Irani has addressed the controversy around the use of a body double in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot. She dismissed rumours and trolls while reflecting on her acting and political journey.

Kiku Sharda confirms return of The Great Indian Kapil Show, addresses exit rumours Kiku Sharda confirms 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' will resume shooting soon. He denies exit rumours and shares his experience on 'Rise and Fall' and Ashneer Grover reality shows.

Khalifa glimpse: Prithviraj Sukumaran looks invincible as Aamir Ali in actioner The first glimpse of 'Khalifa' starring Prithviraj Sukumaran released on his birthday. The promo, titled 'The Bloodline', showcases a stylised London fight sequence.

Govinda gaya: Hero No. 1 star recalls reading articles on his fading stardom Govinda discusses impact of negative media coverage on his career trajectory. Actor explains importance of environment for film success during interview.

Did Tejasswi jab boyfriend Karan Kundrra's ex Anusha Dandekar in birthday post? Tejasswi Prakash posted affectionate photos with Karan Kundrra on his birthday, as recent comments by Anusha Dandekar about a former partner's infidelity have reignited public discourse. The post has drawn attention due to ongoing speculation.

Zeishan Quadri on Tanya Mittal's alleged lies on Bigg Boss 19: Who am I to judge? Zeishan Quadri opens up on his eviction from Bigg Boss 19 and his role in house conflicts. He reflects on betrayals, health struggles, and the support he continues to receive from fans.

Britney Spears calls ex-husband Kevin's constant gaslighting exhausting, slams him Kevin Federline's upcoming memoir reveals his perspective on his turbulent relationship with Britney Spears and their co-parenting struggles, stirring public responses from Spears herself. The revelations highlight ongoing challenges between the ex-couple and their efforts to protect their children's well-being amidst personal conflicts.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Tushaar stripped of captaincy Bigg Boss Tamil 9 captaincy was revoked from Tushaar due to his failure to enforce discipline. This move highlights ongoing tensions and rule-breaking among the contestants.

Rajinikanth and Sundar C eye reunion after Jailer 2, first since 1997's Arunachalam Reports suggest Rajinikanth and Sundar C may team up for a new film following 'Jailer 2'. The project would mark their first collaboration since 'Arunachalam' in 1997.

Oscar-nominated actor Penelope Milford dies at 77 Penelope Milford, known for her Oscar-nominated role in 'Coming Home', died at the age of 77 in New York. She was celebrated for her impactful performances on screen and stage, leaving behind a rich legacy in cinema circles.

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 14: Rishab Shetty film a top grosser in Karnataka Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' has become the highest-grossing film in Karnataka, nearing Rs 200 crore gross in the state. The film's strong box office run hints at a promising future for its sequel and Kannada cinema globally.

Stranger Things creators wanted a cinema release, Netflix says no The much-awaited fifth season of 'Stranger Things' will conclude the series in three parts later this year, exclusively on Netflix. Despite the creators' wish for a cinema release to enhance the viewing experience, Netflix has decided to keep the finale as a streaming-only event.

Mithra Mandali Review: A Jathi Ratnalu clone that's more miss than hitRelease Date:Thu Oct 16, 2025 Written and directed by debutant Vijayender S, 'Mithra Mandali' is yet another addition to the brainless comedy film from Telugu cinema, that banks more on meta/movie references than merit in writing.

How Diwali 2025 marks the arrival of next-gen stars in Tamil and Telugu Diwali 2025 ushers in a new wave of Tamil and Telugu actors with six fresh films. This shift signals a move from superstar dominance to content-driven cinema in South India.

Boots review: Miles Heizer leads a sharp and stirring coming-of-age taleRelease Date:Thu Oct 09, 2025 'Boots' is a gripping 1990s-set coming-of-age drama that swaps teen angst for military drills, blending humour, heart, and grit as a young man discovers courage, identity, and belonging amid unrelenting discipline.

Hollywood icon Diane Keaton died from pneumonia, family confirms Diane Keaton died on October 11 at age 79, with the cause confirmed as pneumonia. Her family thanked supporters and suggested donations to charities close to Keaton's heart.

Dwayne Johnson earns high praise from Christopher Nolan for The Smashing Machine Dwayne Johnson received acclaim from Christopher Nolan for his role in 'The Smashing Machine'. Nolan highlighted Johnson's portrayal as one of the year's best performances.

Red, White & Royal Blue sequel officially announced by Amazon MGM Amazon MGM Studios has announced a sequel to the beloved romantic comedy 'Red, White & Royal Blue', titled 'Red, White & Royal Wedding', directed by Jamie Babbit.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 53: Malti's comment on Nehal's clothes trigger arguments Malti's remark about Nehal's clothes sparked a heated argument in the Bigg Boss house, with Baseer and Kunickaa stepping in to defend Nehal. The incident added to rising tensions as housemates clashed over tasks, rations, and personal conflicts.

general news.headline: Energy choices guided by consumer interest: India on Trump's Russian oil claimThe government on Tuesday reaffirmed that India's energy decisions are guided by consumer interests, focusing on stable prices, secure supplies, and diversified sourcing.

Taliban display pants of Pak soldiers, Afghans vow to join MujahideenThough a fragile 48-hour ceasefire has taken hold, the tensions between Afghanistan and Pakistan are boiling after Pakistani airstrikes deep inside Afghan territory killed 15 civilians. Earlier, the Taliban overran Pakistani outposts and seized uniforms and weapons from the abandoned facilities. The trousers were displayed in public in Afghanistan.

Shoddy work: Kiran Shaw's Bengaluru infra callout gets massive public supportBiocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's posts on Bengaluru's poor roads and garbage management drew massive online support, including BJP and JD(S) leaders. DK Shivakumar said criticism "hurts the state."

Every year a new PM: Trump's epic India-Pakistan mix-up goes viralDonald Trump said India was an incredible country and every single year it saw a new leader. However, it is not India, but Pakistan that fits that description perfectly.

Centre requested: Supreme Court admits it changed decision on judge transferThe Supreme Court collegium reversed its earlier decision, transferring Justice Atul Sreedharan to Allahabad High Court after the Centre's request. This marks a reconsideration of his earlier proposed move to Chhattisgarh.
Why Homebound was not the right pick for India's Oscar entryDespite its strong themes of caste and unemployment, 'Homebound' falls short of the depth and intensity needed for India's Oscar entry.

The party warned that instability could have serious consequences ahead of the upcoming general election.

India-born expert Ashley Tellis denies charges after arrest over top secret filesAshley J Tellis, a US scholar of Indian origin, was arrested on allegations of retaining classified documents and meeting with Chinese officials. His lawyers stated that they will vigorously contest the case.

Trump claimed that PM assured him that New Delhi would stop purchasing oil from Russia.

Papa has been killed: UP boy, 8, unmasks mother's Rs 1 lakh hit on fatherA woman in Barabanki, Uttar Pradesh, paid Rs 1 lakh to an e-rickshaw driver to kill her husband. The crime was exposed when their 8-year-old son revealed the truth to police, resulting in the suspects' arrest.

sports.headline: Jalaj Saxena never playing for India surprises ex-selectors: You were chairman Former India players and selectors Salil Ankola and Chetan Sharma were surprised that veteran Jalaj Saxena had never represented India internationally, despite being one of the most accomplished players in Ranji Trophy history.

Kohli's 'Won't Give Up' Message: A Bold Signal To Selectors Ahead Of 2027 World Cup? This special report unpacks the speculation surrounding Virat Kohli's future following his cryptic message ahead of the crucial India vs. Australia ODI series. Key figures discussed include Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and former cricketer Madanlal, amidst talk of the 2027 World Cup. Kohli's post stated, 'The only time you truly fail is when you decide to give up.' The programme explores if this is a signal of his intent to play in the 2027 World Cup, his return to the ODI squad alongside Rohit Sharma after both retired from Test and T20I formats, and the challenges ahead. The discussion also features analysis from former cricketer Madanlal, who believes in clear communication between the selectors and senior players like Kohli, and notes that Kohli will not give selectors a chance to drop him based on performance. The report also addresses the selection pressures under the Ajit Agarkar-led committee.

Many are linking the tweet to speculation about his participation in the 2027 ICC ODI World Cup.

Carlos Alcaraz defends playing exhibitions amid criticism over gruelling schedule World number one Carlos Alcaraz has defended his participation in the Six Kings Slam exhibition, despite a demanding tennis calendar and a lingering ankle injury. Ishan Kishan hits statement century in Ranji Trophy opener, Shami picks up the paceIshan Kishan scored an unbeaten 125 in the Ranji Trophy opener helping Jharkhand recover from early setbacks. Mohammed Shami's late burst of wickets turned the match in Bengal's favour, creating a thrilling contest.

Ashwin slams India's use of Nitish, suggests Axar Patel as better all-rounderRavichandran Ashwin openly criticised India's decision-making regarding Nitish Kumar Reddy's involvement in the second Test against the West Indies, proposing that Axar Patel would have offered greater impact if Reddy was not to contribute with the ball.

Bangladesh looking to learn from fielding blunders vs Australia: Sobhana MostaryBangladesh aims to address fielding mistakes before facing Australia in the Women's World Cup. The team remains determined despite recent losses and emotional setbacks.

India set to stage Commonwealth Games 2030, Ahmedabad recommended as host cityThe Executive Board of Commonwealth Sports said on Wednesday, October 15 that it will recommend India's Ahmedabad as the proposed host city for 2030 Commonwealth Games. India last hosted the Commonwealth Games in New Delhi in 2010.

Rashid Khan rested for One-off Test as Afghanistan name squads for Zimbabwe tourZIM vs AFG: Rashid Khan has been rested for the one-off Test series against Zimbabwe. Zia Ur Rahman Sharifi, Sharafuddin Ashraf and Khalil Gurbaz have been called up.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
